result.execSummary:
The defendant Kilyne I Pearson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: Count 2, BUT CONSECUTIVE to present sentence.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

Court will allow for transfer to any other county or state if they are willing to accept the defendant.
Consecutive to: present sentence.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is ordered payable to A.W. ($360) and Landmark Credit Union ($261.88) as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines/surcharges.

Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by the agent.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

Criminal Thinking Course.
Not to use or possess anyone else's financial information.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with A.W., her residence or place of employment listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: From Dodge Correctional.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kilyne I Pearson in court, in custody (by video from DCI), with attorney J Anthony Rosario.

Defendant is entering a plea of Guilty to both counts 1 & 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 1 & 2.
Counts 3 - 11 are dismissed as read ins.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison:  5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2 Years.
Extended Supervision:   3 Years.
Concurrent to: Count 2.
Consecutive to:  present sentence.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Consecutive to:  present sentence.
Court will allow for transfer to any other county or State if they are willing to accept him.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATIOIN:  
Criminal Thinking Course.
Not to use or possess anyone else financial information.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by the agent;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim A.W., her residence or place of Employment listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

RESTITUTION:  $621.88 (Breakdown: $360 to victim (A.W.) and $261.88 to Landmark Credit Union- restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $268
DNA Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.





Count 2:
Total Prison: 5  Years.
Initial Confinement: 2  Years.
Extended Supervision:   3 Years.
Concurrent to:  count 1
Consecutive to:  present sentence.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Consecutive to:  present sentence.
Court will allow for transfer any other county or State if they are willing to accept him.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATIOIN:  
Same as Count 1.

Costs:  $268
DNA Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
